issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
There are are new user facing services in 4.1 for cloudformation (simpleworkflow) and EC2 image worker support (imaging)

The imaging service was added in 4.1 to provide a UFS for use by imaging workers. If this service is not added then manual registration would be required to restore image conversion functionality.

The simpleworkflow service was added for more reliable cloudformation workflows. If a cloudformation service is registered it will not be functional until a 
simpleworkflow service is registered.

The cloudformation service was a tech preview in 4.0, so may not be registered on upgraded systems.

We should determine which services (cloudformation, imaging, simpleworkflow) we want to register on upgrade.
fields.summary: New user facing services should be registered on upgrade

comments.body: UFS for imaging needs to be registered by default upon upgrade. If cloudformation is registered, must register simpleworkflow upon upgrade.

On upgrade we now register imaging UFS services on hosts with compute services if no imaging services are found. We also register a simpleworkflow service on each host with a registered cloudformation service if no simpleworkflow services are found.

[~sjones], so if there was no cloudformation registered before upgrade would we expect swf service to be registered? What I saw when I upgraded 4.0.2 (w/o cloudformation) to 4.1 there was no swf service registered. However, the cloudformation service was present post upgrade. And to clarify, if imaging service was present before upgrade we do not do anything with that service?
Thanks.

[~tony], I think the expectations are that:

* If you have imaging or cloudformation functionality in 4.0.x that it will still work after upgrading
* If you do not have cloudformation in 4.0 you will not have cloudformation in 4.1 unless you make manual changes

I can confirm the desired behavior for swf. If cloudformation was enabled on 4.0.2, the upgrade process will register SWF.  [~sjones], I have a couple issues remaining for clarification surrounding upgrade behavior with regard to UFS.

#1 prior to upgrade loadbalancing and imaging services were enabled. After upgrade they are NOT READY.

#2 If cloudformation was not enabled on 4.0.2, the upgrade will result in a cloudformation service being registered and ENABLED yet no SWF service is registered. I no longer have this setup but I presume that cloudformation would not function in this scenario.

[~vasya], would probably be the best person to comment on whether manual steps are necessary to enable loadbalancing and imaging (backend) services on upgrade to 4.1.

It is correct that cloudformation will not function if simpleworkflow is unavailable. It is not expected that cloudformation would be registered on upgrade.
[~spark] added imaging into UFC, so I think it has to be added/registered manually on upgrade. I don't know why loadbalancing disabled on upgrade. [~spark], do you have any ideas?
I don't remember any other constraint but the EMI check.
[~spark], Thank you. EMIs are not set after upgrade. This could be an issue with my upgrade script. Checking.....
Looks like upgrade from EUCA-10191 did not work correctly.
Verification revealed some service issues remain with upgrade.
[~tony], please could you summarize what the issues are that need to be addressed.
[~tony] and [~sjones], I've updated service properties upgrade script.

[~sjones], cloudformation upgrade scenarios/workflow works as designed and explained here in this issue. There was a problem with LoadBalancing and Image services not being handled on upgrade. [~vasya] was able to debug on an upgraded system and has fixed the issue. I'll re-verify ELB and Imaging services issue as soon as new packages are ready.

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.1.0
Release     : 0.0.23010.347.20150115git7f6a353.el6

imaging, loadbalancing and SWF services are registered and enabled when applicable when upgrading from 4.0.2 to 4.1
